field.name: forcesortby
field.label: Forced sort by field
field.description: Type field name to sort by and the order. Example 1: 'title desc' Example 2: 'title asc'. Note that keyword asc is not necessary. Also, you may add MySql date_format() format specifiers. Example: 'birthdate:%m%d DESC' to sort by month and day. You can also use _id to sort by recird ID or _published to sort by Publish State

field.name: filter
field.label: Search Parameter
field.description: field to search in = (or < or <= or > or >= or != and == 'exact match') value (or special macro as {currentuserid} for example ) to have more then one equation use AND, OR to get value from url query add '$get_' to parameter name, example 'username=$get_user' this will read value 'user' from url query. To get current date use {date:Ymd} or {date:Y} for the year or {date:n} for the month. If its about date field type you can use the following: {year}, {month}, {day}. Also you can format the date using MySql date_format() format specifiers, example 1: {now:%m}. Example 2: 'birthdate:%m%d DESC' to get the month and the day of the field value.

field.name: onrecordaddsendemailto
field.label: On Record Add Send Email to
field.description:
The email with the data filled in the form will be sent to this email. More than one email is ok. Separate them with the comma.
Also you may use a value of the field of the table to send an email to. To have your own Email Subject please type : after email and then the subject. Example 1: [email] Example 2: test@yahoo.com,test@gmail.com,[email] Example 3: [email]:Thank you for participation
